intro: Andersonia latiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaved Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are broad and leathery, providing a striking contrast to its delicate blooms. Andersonia latiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
